name: Kepler-221
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-221 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-221 is a star with 0.7150000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.82 times its radius. It is located 1270.54 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-221 is known to have 4 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-221 b

Kepler-221 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.04 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 2.80 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-221.

The mass of Kepler-221 b is 3.51 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-221 b is 1.71 that of Earth. At 3.51 Earth masses, Kepler-221 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-221 c

Kepler-221 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.06 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 5.69 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-221.

The mass of Kepler-221 c is 12.65 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-221 c is 2.93 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-221 c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-221 d

Kepler-221 d was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.04 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-221.

The mass of Kepler-221 d is 10.76 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-221 d is 2.73 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, Kepler-221 d is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.

Kepler-221 e

Kepler-221 e was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.13 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 18.37 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-221.

The mass of Kepler-221 e is 9.83 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-221 e is 2.63 that of Earth. At 9.83 Earth masses, Kepler-221 e is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-221, which contains 4 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
